title.narrative: ENABLING ENVIRONMENTS

description.narrative: Children and adolescents grow up in enabling environments that promote improved nutrition., which contributes to Evaluation, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, child and adolescent malnutrition in all its forms is reduced, with a special focus on overweight and obesity.

participating-org.narrative: RELAF RED LATINOAMERICANA DE ACOGIMIENTO FAMILIAR

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and adolescents grow up in enabling environments that promote improved nutrition.

description.narrative: UNICEF’s advocacy and technical support to the Ministry of Health contributed to the development of a National Strategyon Healthy, Fair and Sustainable Diets. The modified NOM-051 on food and beverage labelling was accompanied in its second stage prohibiting use of techniques that attract children to unhealthy food products. National bylaws were strengthened to improve regulation of marketing of unhealthy food and beverage and are awaiting publication. An assessment of the new primary and secondary school curriculumVida Saludablewas started to advocate for maintaining and strengthening the new teaching, which reaches all 23 million students in Mexico. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:26/01/2022

title.narrative: Number of schools providing direct nutrition interventions, Number
Number of schools providing direct nutrition interventions, Number
Number of schools providing direct nutrition interventions, Number
Number of schools providing direct nutrition interventions, Number
Implementation of food and beverage guidelines and educational programmes in schools for the prevention of all forms of malnutrition, Text

baseline.value: Inadequate National Guidelines for food and beverages sale and distribution in schools under review by government and inadequate nutrition, hygiene and physical activity content, dispersed across different school health and nutrition programmes

target.value: 2025:Adequate National Guidelines for food and beverages sale and distribution in schools and Vida Saludable (Healthy Life) programme with Adequate nutrition, hygiene and physical activity content, both implemented in primary and secondary schools

actual.value: 2021:- Despite strong advocacy by UNICEF, MOH and civil society, the improved National Guidelines for food and beverages sale and distribution in schools have not been yet published (pubblication is expected in first quarter 2022). - Implementation of Vida S

title.narrative: Regulation on marketing of breast-milk substitutes and food and beverages aimed at children, Text

baseline.value: Inadequate regulation on food and beverage marketing to children

target.value: 2025:Adequate regulation on marketing of breast-milk substitutes and on food and beverages aimed at children enforced by government, benefiting all children and adolescents in Mexico (38 million children)

actual.value: 2021:A further improved version of the marketing regulation was finalized with UNICEF inputs. Despite multiple efforts from UNICEF, MOH and civil society, the executive draft has not yet been published as it is awaiting President's approval since september 202

title.narrative: Rate of implementation of NOM 051 on food labelling and its consistency with other food regulations, Text

baseline.value: Updated NOM 051 on food labelling is not implemented in Mexico and is not consistent with other food regulations

target.value: 2025:Updated NOM 051 with a new front of package warning label is fully implemented in Mexico and is consistent with advertising and school food sale regulations, benefiting all children and adolescents in Mexico (38 million children)

actual.value: 2021:Nom 051 with a new front of package warning label implemented with nutrition criteria of the first stage; Health Authorities Guideline for its monitoring adopted
